description: This family run Mexican food truck has lots of meat choices. Cabeza, Tripas, Buche, Chivo, lengua offerings makes this truck very special. If you live or work in SoMa this is a must try.
author: Madhu J.

description:
Perhaps I should've ordered tacos like everyone else, but got a torta instead.  (Took a bite out of my coworkers, but meh) Anyway, I can't help but compare to San Diego when it comes to Mexican food.  I haven't found a single taco shop/truck that compares to it. 

But overall, it's cheap! So yay.
author: Kevin Y.

description:
On (actually near) the Bryant and 6th St Intersection you'll find the El Norteno Taco Truck. Be careful because there is another taco truck on the same side of the street that is a stone's throw away. Look for the signage that indicates "El Norteno taco Truck" (obvious, but I almost went to the other spot). 

Wasn't really planning on getting taco's but I happened to be in the area and I had this place bookmarked for some time.

As other's have mentioned the wait staff is very friendly, dare I say amongst the friendliest/ most charismatic I've encountered at a Taco truck. In the rough and tumble world of SF eating establishments sometimes this can be make or break for a business, b/c let's be honest there are A LOT of options for Taco's, food you name it in a big city. It's this same logic that I'm extremely sweet to my wife b/c I know she has other options if I ever decide to "change"... : oP 

But back to the tacos...I went with Carnitas , Tripas (chitlings) and Lengua . To top it off I just had to get Mexican coke because that cane sugar is just amazing. You can't have tacos without Mandarin Jarritos or Mexican coke...I mean..you can....but it won't taste nearly as good.

The tacos here were very good and firmly in the upper tier of my taco rankings below. Flavorful, juicy and fresh.  There are regulars here I can tell because the friendly wait staff was asking about their families , their work, it was like watching the bartenders at your local neighborhood watering hole. 

Solid spot would reccomend for tacos

The world needs a San Francisco Taco ranking...so I'm here to provide my humble list/rankings. 

Ranking explained:  #1 (listed at the top) is my favorite/ #?  (listed at the bottom) is my least favorite. 

When I look at reviews sometimes just want to know where to go or how a user compares one venue against another to see if we have similar tastes. If you're curious, I have rankings for Boba, Bakeries and Ramen , Chicken and Waffles as well (random right?)  Follow my profile to see my most recent reviews.  I hope I can be helpful since so many Yelpers have helped me discover new places.  

Rod's SF Taco Rankings:

2 Garajito
3 Belmar La Gallinita Meat Market
4 La Corneta
5 Chisme
6 El Norteno Taco Truck
7 Taqueria Los Mayas

23 Tacos San Buena

28 Nick's Crispy Tacos

Below is my top 10 for the Bay Area in case you were curious.

2 El Jaliciense
3 Taqueria Sinaloa
4 Garajito
5 Belmar La Gallinita Meat Market
6 Belly
7 La Corneta
8 Chisme

10 Taqueria Los Mayas
author: Rod M.

description:
Decent and fresh mexican food. I wouldn't call this place the "best tacos"...tortillas are coming out of a bag. But it is fast, and tastes overally good.

Ignore the five start reviews and take this place for what it is.
author: Mith R.

description:
The best burrito truck I know of. 
Super burrito, carne Assad's, black beans, salsa roja.
author: Mason C.

description: A daylong workshop at our SOMA office required some good lunch, and participants requested something new. El Norteno delivered 32 delicious burritos (pork, steak, chicken and veggie), plus soda and chips and salsa fir a reasonable price. In fact, multiple participants asked to know "who made these amazing burritos?" I have a feeling we will be ordering from El Norteno, again!
author: Brian P.

description:
I'm pretty sure the El Norteno Taco Truck serves the best tacos in the city.

I come here for lunch at least once a week, and I've never been disappointed. I get quick and friendly service every time.

My favorite menu items are:

- shrimp tacos (shrimp is perfectly cooked every single time)
- chiva tacos (meat is so flavorful and tender)
- chicken soup (add lime, so satisfying for the cold rainy days)

4 tacos or 3 tacos & a small soup typically cost me ~$12-$13. Great value for a delicious lunch.

They also serve breakfast!
author: Grace C.

description:
El Norteno Burrito is amazing, my small team has ordered 500+ meals here over the last couple years, and would happily order 500 more; their food and service is awesome. We've tracked our orders for some time; below are our favorite selections:

**Top 2 Food Vehicles**
Super Burrito: 261 orders
Super Bowl: 134

Note: "Super Tacos" didn't make the top 2, but it's a recent favorite

**Top 5 Protein Options**
Chicken: 223 orders
Carnitas: 64
Carne Asada: 18
Carnitas + Al Pastor: 18
Chicken + Shrimp: 16

Note: there are 32 unique protein combinations we've tried, these are just the top 5. Tip: add shrimp to anything, it's delicious.

**Most requested ingredient change: substitute Black Beans for Pinto (16% of orders)**

**Most unusual request: "Make my burrito extra tubular"**

**Spiciness**
Mild: 65% of orders
Spicy: 23%
Medium: 12%

**Note: Spicy is actually spicy, not for the faint of heart. Medium has a little kick, but there's more emphasis on flavor than heat. Don't like any heat? Mild is perfect for you.**

We've tried nearly everything on the menu, and we love it all. Enjoy!
author: Patrick C.

description: Without a doubt, the best food truck super carnitas burrito I've ever had. The carnitas were hot and crispy; no doubt freshly made to order. So, if you find yourself at the criminal courthouse, give them a try!
author: Tom K.

description: I can't get enough of El Norteno Taco Truck! They have the best tacos! For the longest time I've always turned my nose up towards taco trucks, but El Norteno Taco Truck changed my attitude. The staff is always so nice and friendly, they are clean, and the food is consistently amazing. The tacos are so simple, yet so tasty. I've been trying to find a good Mexican spot for a while now- this is definitely it. I like that they have a variety of beans they serve, the carne asada is always nice and juicy, so many choices of meat to choose from, and different types of salsa. I wish they were open on weekends, I would totally come all the way downtown just to eat here!
author: Andrea M.

description: The best chicken burrito in San Francisco! I also tried a small chicken taco which was very good. I did not like the enchillada that they only serve in the mornings. There are also steep discounts offered on Restaurant.com.
author: Charmaine L.

description: I have found the comfort and tastes from home sorta speak,I have to say have been to many different taco shops,Mexican restaurants and they're good but they dont compare to El Nortenos .I'm from fresno ca and I've been up in redding,ca for 31 years (I'm 41)and in Fresno you can taste the culture the last bite is as good as the first,and I've missed that til I drove over the bridge were they park for lunch( over across from RareAir).So we cant keep our hands off of they're tacos which are JUICY,FRESH INGREDIENTS, JUST THE RIGHT AMOUNT OF SEASONING PLATE OF GOOD AUTHENTIC FOOD FOR A FEW DOLLARS. THEYRE THE FLAVOR REDDING NEEDS ...
author: Noelle H.

description:
Thissss giiiirrllll is on fiiiiyaaahhhh!! 

Omg!  I'm writing this up while simultaneously trying to extinguish the fire  in my mouth! Wooooooo haaaaaaaa!!!

Was feeling like tacos for lunch today, so I decided to walk on over to the El Norteno Taco Truck. Ordered a steak and a chicken taco and I was asked if I'd like them mild or spicy.  I'm sure you can figure out which one I opted for. Ssssss (ohh! that burns so good!). I have a pretty high tolerance for heat; for me it was borderline  intolerable. I'd recommend getting the tacos mild but asking for the spicy sauce on the side.  

Spicy sauce/salsa: they definitely use orange habanero peppers and if you know what habanero peppers are, you would know that these lil babies not only pack a lot of great flavor, but are near the top of the list of having the highest levels of capsaicin. Pretty much the hottest pepper you can find at your local grocer.  This sauce is addicting, but definitely needs to be consumed with precaution! You will sweat, cry, go numb and possibly blind... But it's so good you will ache for more.  

Remember... ORDER MILD - SPICY SAUCE ON THE SIDE!   

Now excuse me while I go chug another gallon of water.
author: Shamina K.

description:
1 lb 9 oz. 

Yes, I weighed my burrito (don't judge me... we have food grade scales at my office). And in this case this place is NOT quantity over quality. Somehow they manage to make one of the tastiest burritos I've had at a size that is gargantuan!

This place is a staple for my office, and no matter what we try on the menu it has been FANTASTIC. Perfect levels of spice, my burritos are never sopping wet or dripping, and the ratio of ingredients is just damn perfect. Never over or under-seasoned, I swear whoever is running this joint is a meticulous wizard.
author: Christine K.

description: El Norteno taco truck is one of my favorite places to grab a quick bite when I work from home a couple days a week from SOMA. The pollo asado tacos are my go-to, and I love the spicy green and red salsas that they typically provide with orders. The chips and salsa are a cheap addition ($1.50) and overall provide an inexpensive weekday lunch option.
author: Clayton B.

description:
Damn, that's one delicious taco. And there goes the second one down my tummy. And where's the third? Why didn't I order a third taco?!

I came at around noontime. There was a small line but it goes by quickly. Placed my order for 2 super tacos - one carnitas and one carne asada, both mild. It came out to be $6.75 for both. In less than ten minutes, I got my tacos and was able to head back to the office. There's no tables for you to eat on so you would have to be creative and find some steps or sidewalk seating.

I was happy to open up my box and see that it came with a side of rice and beans. Tacos had a good heaping of sour cream and guacamole (my two favorite things). The outer tortilla of the taco was so amazingly crispy! Both the carnitas and carne asada were solid picks. Definitely would come back again soon for more tacos regardless if it's Taco Tuesday or not!
author: Diana C.

description: The best carne asada tacos and burritos in SF are on a food truck in downtown San Francisco! I'm from So Cal where there are many great taco shops and it's been very hard finding anything close to what So Cal has to offer.
author: Kim B.

description:
I want to give them ALL THE STARS! Grabbed 3 tacos for lunch after an ad on Yelp popped up yesterday for them...so had to go today and very glad I did. This will be my new lunch spot on the regular. 

Had chorizo (good), al pastor (great), and cabeza (amazing!!). Side note: cabeza is just beef cheek, not brains, so definitely give it a try because the meat is so tender. Loved the hot sauce. Got it on side. 

But MOST IMPORTANTLY: a taco is only as good as its tortilla...and here they were cooked to a nice crisp perfectly. 

I've already contemplated going back for more tacos today, but will wait until tomorrow and then more again next week. I'm not kidding. Also, think my order needs to be a 4 taco setup moving forward. They are too delicious!!
author: Steph A.

description:
$2 a taco? COUNT ME IN! I purchased 3 beef tacos with onions, lettuce, cheese, salsa. It was a fair portion size (and meat) for a good price of 10$. Good customer service and okay food for hungry people. 

I think I'll be going here for my jury duty lunch breaks.
author: Liza H.

description:
I just discovered this little gem and am now hooked. 

Just a couple blocks from my work, I have been tired of the other places close by, as they all overcharge for what you get. 

Everyone on the truck always cheery and a pleasure to deal with. The food is hot, fresh, and good serving size.

I am now a regular and highly recommend them.
author: Andy T.

description:
Best everrrrr...I will def, be returning to this place!!! Best food
Best service
Always delish!!!!!!!!!!
Never dissapointed!!!!!!!
Tell you friends and fam!
author: Lindsey H.

description: It was okay. Tacos were made unusually fast. A little pricey, but expected. Probably will come here again for a quick eat!
author: Tilly D.

description: My sister and I had lunch from this taco truck. She had the regular cheese quesadilla with everything on the side. The guacamole was amazing! The quesadilla was filled with cheese and it was huge. I ordered 2 carne asada tacos and 2 al pastor with tomatillo sauce and cilantro and onions. The tacos were delicious and the corn tortillas had the great crunch to them from being warmed up on the flat top! Great food
author: Ashley A.

description:
El Norteno taco truck feed our Super bowl Party, they were hired and parked out front of our house bringing us delicious food for hours!  Magdalena kept a steady stream of platters full of tacos, quesadillas, chips and salsa.  The food was amazing and nobody left hungry! Special platers were made for the vegetarians and gluten free folks as well!

Muchas Gracias Magdalena and crew!
author: nancy h.

description:
A very convenient taco truck.

Sucks for whoever has to come down here for jury duty, but if you need a quick place for food, this taco truck is right in front. It's either this or Turtle Tower nearby, but Turtle Tower is popular so there's the lengthy wait for that restaurant. When you come here, their menu (slightly scratched out) is posted to the side. Once you order, you're given a number for your food. There isn't any place around for seating except the seatwalls/steps in front of the Hall of Justice. Too bad Caffe Roma doesn't allow outside food.

I ordered the Nachos Super w/ Carne Asada.

This order was quite filling, and well, it is a super. Garnished with a few slices of avocado, peppers, carrots, and mozzarella cheese.

Pros: lots of nachos and melted cheese
Cons: not enough sour cream (though maybe I should've asked for more mini containers), not enough pieces of beef

It's a taco truck, so maybe I should've ordered tacos instead.
author: Kevin S.

description:
The plus:  The burrito seemed to taste good

The bad: Very little meat inside and I found Pollo inside my Carne Asada burrito.

The alternative:  You can find much better burritos for a similar price nearby
author: Andrew H.

description:
Very convenient if you're at jury duty at the Hall of Justice (just across the street; but note that this is not the first taco truck, which is closer to the street light when you exit the Hall of Justice, but the second one you'll come across as you walk towards 6th Street).

I enjoyed my meal of two tacos and a tamale and noticed that the tacos came with a lot more than I had expected (e.g. radish, I think, and pickled vegetable, and salsa, plus more). Unfortunately, a couple weeks have passed so I do not remember additional details about the tacos.
author: I Like T.

description: Everything is awesome. Super friendly, great hospital and delicious home made Mexican food! Come several times a week
author: Jeff N.

description: Picked up a tongue super burrito here for my meal pal! I was super excited to try it since meal pal doesn't offer many burritos on the menu. Got there, told the woman taking orders that I was picking up Meal Pal for Yen and waited for my food. The lady then said my Meal Pal was ready for Jon or however you say your name. I got my burrito which looked huge and asked for salsa for it. She then looked at me and said "Please??". Really? I was not rude and was just asking for salsa politely! I would give this place a 1 star for being so rude but I'll give it a 2 for the size of the burrito! Definitely will not be back or recommend it to my friends or family.
author: Yen F.

description: Where to start. I've been worshipping at this temple of burritos for several years at least once per week. In my opinion it's among the best burritos in the city. The Carnitas and Pastor are religious experiences, make sure you opt for super. The people who run the truck are also wonderful.
author: Zachary L.

description: The burrito bowl is where it's at! Carnitas is on point and it comes with avocado instead of guac. Great value especially when you sweet talk the nice lady into giving you extra hot sauces.
author: Shannon B.

description: Best burrito I've had in years. Bravo! I got the carne asada super burrito but I'm sure anything you get from this place meets high standards.
author: Kray P.

description: I work nearby and go here for lunch multiple times per month. The people who work here are very nice and I've always been happy with the food - carnitas & chicken burritos, shrimp tacos, nachos to share, chicken soup. A vegan coworker was able to find satisfying options!
author: Anna K.

description: You know how there are some food trucks and restaurants who are just located in high traffic areas to take advantage of the lack of food options? This food truck is one of them. They aren't cheaper than restaurants and yet their food quality is horrible. All of their meats are overly salted and overcooked. How they can sit there and charge $15 for a meat plate that is horrible is beyond me. Their tacos are usually meh also. They use way too much salt to cover the low quality meat they're serving. Avoid.
author: Henry W.

description: Finally made it to the taco truck today! $2 for street tacos. I got 2 pollo and 1 carnitas. Apparently $2 is considered cheap for SF, but I've had similar for $1 down in the South Bay. On the positive side, they are generous with the meat in their tacos such that these came out to a good 4-5 bites each. And their chicken and pork were equally tasty! Their salsa verde has good heat with a nice kick to it. The tacos also came topped with pickles and jalapenos, which was a nice touch. Strangely enough, I got two wedges of what looked like lemons (bright yellow!) instead of limes. I also got a side of rice, which was super tasty, also $2. My $8 lunch was probably the cheapest and fast meal you can purchase in SOMA. There was a line outside this truck when we got there around 12:30, but it moved very quickly. Too bad there is nowhere to sit and enjoy your meal on a nice day. The truck does have one small counter jutting off the back, but it's usually occupied. I'll be back when I need a walk outside the office. Service is super fast and friendly.
author: Leslie H.

description:
I would give this truck 0 stars if I could. This truck had terrible customer service and the quality of the food was also terrible. First, they wanted to charge me $5 for a Costco bottle of water (the whole pack of 36 is a little more than $5....) After I said no to the overpriced water, they became super hostile and begrudgingly took my order. 

I waited an eternity for my order, probably because many people that ordered after me received their orders before me. I finally received mine, and it was inedible. It was sooooo spicy that I could only eat a couple bites.... and I like spicy food! 

My experience with this truck was terrible. Never again.
author: Helen N.

description:
The burritos here are great, and the people who work here are even better. 

A classic SF Burrito, and imho, better than El Farolito and a lot of the taquerias in the mission. Make sure you get extra meat, I go with the carne asada burrito and it does not disappoint.
author: Sas P.

description:
This is one of the few places where the tripas come out crispy on the outside and buttery on the inside, as opposed to a soft, soggy, chewy mess like in most joints in our city. The cabeza is meltingly good, and the other meats aren't bad either. The quick-moving long lines are a positive sign, if anything. 
The only drawback is this truck is located across from the Hall of Justice, so it's more of spot you go to if you're in the area. (Good luck finding parking if you're going as a destination.)
author: Andrew L.

description:
Among the top 5 burritos in SF.
Anyone who thinks otherwise, please reply so that I can discover.
author: John M.

description: Off the hook truck. We are building down the street and I hit it 3 times a week. Super friendly owners and the carnitas burrito bowl is amazing...everything fresh and their tomatillo sauce is crazy good. Try the chicken soup and buy their fresh chips and crush them in it. Sooooo good. Havent had one bad thing from this truck.
author: Mike G.

description:
*** CASH ONLY ***

I came in search of the Chivo (goat) taco (#92 in sF Foodie's top 100 things to eat in SF http://blogs.sfweekly.com/foodie/2011/01/el_norteno_goat_tacos_sfoodies_92.php) and was told didn't have it today.

Got the fall back 2 al pastor & 2 lengua, no cilantro. $1.50 each.

They came with salsa verde, some onions, a sliver of pickled jalapeno, lime wedge, and a bit of cilantro on two of the tacos (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/2ZgnUtbF_qqbyfKZ9Tvhcg?select=9-t21tD0g_VSlyEO4KBckQ) 

The meats were tender and flavorful, especially the lengua and the salsa verde had a nice kick. I had two issues:
- Tortillas needed more time on the grill. By the time I got to my car (1/2 block), the tortillas were soggy and starting to fall apart.
- Inconsistent amount of meat. The tacos on the left and top of my picture had a good amount that lasted through the life of the taco, but the ones on the bottom & right had about a bite of meat for the whole taco.

4 stars for flavor. loses a star for execution
author: Andrew C.

description:
If you work around this area, you know it's slightly desolate in terms of the immediate food choices (compared to the rest of downtown). Given that, I'm giving this place five stars for being the most consistently solid spot on the block, and serving up a wide variety of meats for your tacos, burritos, tortas, you name it. 

I typically get a burrito with lengua or al pastor, and it always fills me up for practically the rest of the day. AND their spicy option is actually pretty fricken spicy. They are very friendly and are efficient in serving the lunch rush. Must try!
author: Kristen F.

description:
I ordered a super shrimp burrito (about $11) and that price tag always gets me, but I do it to myself, really. 
But once I bit into the burrito I kind of forgot where I was, did I just blackout a bit? It was amazing. First, they got my order correct (avocado, not guac. no hot sauce. cilantro and onion but no tomato). Second, they cook the shrimp with some onions that just send that bad boy over the top. 
Its a big burrito and because I have no self control I attempt to eat the whole thing in one sitting. I always cant move after, but at least Im happy.
the downside is there is no chips included. But honestly, I forgot about that once I started eating.

My coworkers usually get tacos but I don't think I can say no to their burrito right now.
author: Kat H.

description:
4 stars!

This taco truck http://s3-media3.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/V8t1gYJtohO0eCu8O_XfqA/l.jpg parked on the corner of Smart Parking lot next to the 5 Star Parking lot, is often my first stop when doing jury duty service at the Hall of Justice on Bryant street. http://s3-media3.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/k9NCJhKKLaeJ7o_2SQXhmA/l.jpg Now less often, since the latest surge of registered voters has reduced the chances of getting called for jury service (normally once every 12 months).

On my latest visit earlier this year, i got some carnitas and lengua tacos ($1.50 each). http://s3-media1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/h7Irp0iD3Yp_jU0Q3FKdkw/l.jpg The extensive menu also includes burritos, quesadillas, tortas (sandwiches), nachos, and rice plates, everything priced under $10. The owner is super friendly and helpful.

CASH only.
Hours: M-F 7am-4pm
author: Luis C.

description: Killer food!  Hot sauce is perfect!  Not too hot but has a great kick.  The el pastor is epic.  Top burrito in the district
author: MJ D.

description:
Great and huge burrito. The super pollo put me back over $9 but it is huge, really two meals if you are a person with average appetite. They are very friendly, fast and accept credit cards with no minimum (unlike most other places in the area). The spicy was indeed spicy but not anything crazy hot.  Your nose will run and your lips will feel warm for a while after you are done but if you like spicy foods, it's fine. If you want super spicy that makes you feel pain, you might need to ask for additional peppers or hot sauce.
Update: he does overcharge!! Wtf twice
author: Piper W.

description:
First note: I am not a food truck fan. I like to sit relax and eat, not stand in the hot sun and get my food in a rush. Don't try to convince me of those food truck malls. Nothing compares to a good cozy neighborhood location. 

But there are those days you are hungry and time is precious. I also work in a food desert. If I liked Subway or McDolands I would be in heaven, but I don't. 

So El Norteno is my next best option. 

As my friends know, if they don't have real toritalla chips I will never be a huge fan. Having a truck, I'm sure this is not an easy task. I give a little break for this. 

Nice people though,  pretty good burritos.  If you want extra hot sauce you have to beg for it. ;)

The husband and wife that run this truck are soooo nice so it keeps me coming back.
author: Sharon S.

description:
Stumbled upon this place on a walk towards another lunch spot, and decided to give it a try with my gf.

2 chicken tacos- very good.

Super veggie burrito- also very good

2 drinks and chips =$17 about the same as our favorite spot in the mission. 

The guys there were also super friendly and we had our food in less than 10 minutes. I would definitely go there again to satisfy a mid day Mexican craving.
author: Harris G.

description: their burritos are pretty good. i guess in original mexico food you'd go for tacos but in SF where tacos are $$ - these burritos are pretty decent. its flavorful. i got it through meal-pal so  was decent. i wouldnt eat daily but its good. coletta gelato is also on the way to this place from fidi which is my justified walk to eat a burrito.  cook your own food. your body and face will thank you at 40. but eat this too, hey burrito is as best as american food gets
author: A N.

description: The burrito I ordered was perfect! The tortilla was really fresh and soft that it will melt in your mouth in seconds! The whole burrito was extremely delicious. It is only 8 minutes walking distance from my workplace. I finally found my go to place. I ordered through Yelp/Eat24 and I skipped the long line! :-)
author: Joe K.

description:
El Norteno has the usual torta, taco, and burrito offerings with an expansive meat options. didn't notice the pricing so i went with the special on the standing billboard.

locale: OTG mcCoppin(11/19)

eats: 3 taco special (7.75) with beans/rice, and soda.
-cabeza(brain)
brains a little mushy
-tripa(small intestines)
fried for some reason, didn't enjoy it
-lengua(tongue)
tender minichucks
*all in dual wrapped mini flour tortillas
*came with small portion of pinto beans and rice, not refried. ok , fresh
*choice of sodas,(coke, mango nectar,  got italian orange (pelli....)
*some pickled carrots, jalepenos provided.

frijoles refritos:
-not sure if fresh meats used. all tasted tender
-orders assembled to made. meats probably premade
-took about 5 minutes to prep
-would repeat. buche (stomach) next time
-special was a good fulfulling, tasty,   deal....4 stars
author: Victor G.

description: I HATE food trucks.  I think that they are disgusting and germ-ridden.  My friend convinced me to visit El Norteno, so I got two tacos.  They were actually pretty good and the food truck also looked to be fairly clean.  I only gave this place a 3 because of the fact that they serve food out of a truck.
author: Tom Z.

description: Love these guys. They are super friendly, and seem to be great at remembering their regulars, which I think is a huge plus given the PLETHORA of food trucks we have, even more so the pop-and-pops type of good ol' Mexican taco trucks like El Norteno's. If you don't know what to get, you can't ever go wrong with a carne asada burrito. So so so good. They are generous with their servings too ;)
author: Arlynne S.

description:
I've been eating here at least twice a week since January. No joke. The carne asada and carnitas tacos are deeeeelishhhh! Meat is moist and they have super spicy sauce! Also, their nachos are really good and come in a half order or full order. They're loaded with your normal toppings like cheese, sour cream, guac, jalapenos, beans?, and meat if you'd like it. I don't know what I'm going to do when I'm no longer near this truck. There will be tears. 

Service is quick and good too! I believe they also accept cards. +10 points.
author: Chau T.

description:
I never write reviews but I had to after my experience with this taco truck.

Why did I give it a 1 star review? The people that run this taco truck are straight up racist and shady. 

Found this taco truck on Halloween as part of Ghost Ship. Went up to the truck and asked for a burrito but the guy taking orders said the only thing left was veggie nachos. How about tacos? No, only veggie nachos. How about a quesadilla? No, only veggie nachos. Is there anything else I can get? No, only veggie nachos. Ok fine, I'll get the veggie nachos... 

As I'm waiting in line guess what happens? All I see is burritos coming out - the person who was literally right behind me in line walked off with a carne asada burrito. Another person 3 or 4 spots behind me said he got 2 burritos and 1 order of tacos. WTH? I stick around and watch the orders for a bit and it turns out only the people of my "skin color" are the ones getting the veggie nachos. What's even worse, when I tell the cooks I want to change my order because this is ridiculous, they had the audacity to say they already made my veggie nachos so they can't give me a burrito.  

I usually like giving people the benefit of the doubt but if you want to so blatantly discriminate against customers, you might as well put up a sign that says, "We only serve certain races". Not going to let this one go - going to make sure everybody hears about it.
author: Caleb T.

description:
I really like their tortas. I went for the Chorizo torta. I usually judge how good a burrito or taco place is based on their chorizo meat.  Their service was fast and friendly. Their tortas come in two sizes, large and extremely large. The torta I had was warm and toasted. They did not skimp on the toppings. It was fresh, flavorful, and filling. You can add eggs to your chorizo meat in case you feel like having breakfast at 4 pm. The chorizo meat was delicious. It was finely grounded, not chewy, very moist, and oozing with the famous red dye no. 6 color oil that all good chorizo meat have. Conveniently located next to the jail at 850 Bryant.  Hence, if you work at or near 850 Bryant, or you expect to go to jail, or you  have been bailed out of jail, or possibility acquitted, you should try this place out, instead of the MacDonald's.  

El Norteno Taco Truck also participates in the San Francisco Off the Grid roaming mobile food extravaganza on Saturdays (midday) at the end of McCoppin street.
author: Hiroshi K.

description: I always look forward to visiting this truck!  There is never a long line and it is conveniently located across from the court house.  I don't think most patrons of this food truck fully appreciate the scope of the menu.  There is lengua-tongue, Sosa-brains, Cabeza-head, shrimp and goat. Service is fast and the food is delicious.
author: M S.

description:
Food trucks ftw! This place is killer. The carnitas are the best I've had anywhere in SF. The people who run the food truck are friendly as well. Service is quick, food is amazing, people are friendly. Doesn't get much better than that.

Haven't had burritos as I'm GF, but I hear they're pretty darn incredible.

Update: Amazing food. But, the nachos... don't order if you are not a fan of cheese sauce. I'm personally not a fan, so I didn't find the nachos very good. I do however, love everything else I've ever had from here.
author: Marc C.

description:
Favourite: lengua tacos mmmmmmms

Thank you for the fresh meats (and parts)
Thank you for accommodating my random requests
Thank you for speeding things up at lunch time
Thank you for giving me extra sawses

Definitely a staple for the whole justice department across the street.
And the made-up ladies in black who look like they took a cab from
Sephora downtown only to come here? Impressed, if that's the case.

Note: they are not always here, as they do take days off for catering.
Note 2: they now take credit cards through Square 
(and their receipt is cute, so it will make you feel bad if you didn't tip them!)
author: Jade T.

description:
after waiting in line at traffic court in the Hall of Justice with the lowest forms of human criminal life, i go back to my car to go to work. whoa! there is a taco truck here!  and after the first bite of my carnitas soft taco, i knew that this was the real deal holyfield! after beto the stylish young man inside the taco truck saw me photographing my carnitas soft taco, he knew that i was a yelper. hahaha. 
the good news is that this taco truck also parks at a gourmet food truck called "off the grid" at 3 different parts of town - upper haight THURS 4pm-dusk, the Fort Mason center FRI 5pm-9pm, and civic center plaza on FRI 11am-2:30.  http://tinyurl.com/23wo9o3

this taco truck is worth it!
author: Jeff W.

description:
Coming back from TechCrunch Disrupt, I walked past el Norteno and given I have trouble turning down Taco/Burrito trucks, I decided to give it a try.

El Norteno is similar to most other taco trucks. I had the al pastor burrito, supreme, with red sauce. The burrito was ok, but my big complaint was how dry the burrito was. There was an incredible amount of rice, leading to an off-tilt Rice to Meat ratio. Additionally, the pork, which is normally a pretty moist meat in burritos, was dry to the level of dog food. It was grisly, had very little flavor and the incredibly dry texture left a lot to be desired.

Even for a restaurant on wheels, I expect more than what I got at this trip to el Norteno.

I hope others have enjoyed a better experience.
author: Justin O.

description:
Food was good, but beware the will make up prices depending on how drunk or an easy target they suspect the buyer will be. 

None of the prices were listed and we ordered guac and chips, a water and a coke. $18!!! as the guy just made it up right there. At that point it was already made so had to accept it.
author: WIlliam M.

description:
I've never been to a taco truck that served breakfast burritos with more than just eggs, meat and maybe some salsa. I guess that's how "gourmet" trucks are doing it to surplus filler. I'm making a safe inference that the folks running this truck were of Latino descent, I know they don't eat guacamole with their damn chorizo and egg burritos, so why are you offering me that shit?!

The burrito was lackluster. Nothing shined, there were about 4 papa cubes in it, a little bit of salsa and a TON of rice. And there were beans, which were also a shock. I asked for papas in my burrito, that's potatoes for you gringos, because I didn't know there would be rice in it. 

I suppose those who get the guacamole, crema, beans, rice, chorizo, eggs, salsa - and the fucking anchor hanging off the Queen Mary - don't notice a flavor lack because there's so many ingredients going on. But, that's not how I role, folks. And the next morning, I made me lad a real chorizo, egg and papa breakfast and he saw the light.

And it didn't cost $7 either.
author: Illyanna M.

description: The burritos are tasty. Tacos are well priced and full of yummy things! Service is and has always been very customer oriented. Super friendly staff! I'm picky and they make my food my way with a smile!!! Gotta try the dirty tacos on Wednesday. I hear they might become a weekly lunch item!!! Best Mexican food within a four block radius of the hall of justice!!!! Dsd
author: Darrin D.

description: This seriously is challenging my standard for favorite burrito. I had a super al pastor and chose spicy over mild. It took a few bites before it really hits me. Probably one of the best al pastors in the city, and that hot sauce, which I think they say is a habanero sauce is really good. It's a very simple burrito......beans, rice, meat, onion, crema, guac, hot sauce, cilantro. I asked for no beans as Im just not a bean person. They are somewhat light on the sour cream and guac, so for those who like it heavy you may want more, but it was fine with me. Meat portion was standard if not a little generous. If you got jury duty, really solid burrito.
author: Gary L.

description: Last week I worked a 12 hour shift and got off work at 8am, had to go to 850 Bryant Street to file a police report, took 2 hours, I was already irritated because I was getting the runaround, finally got it handled, afterwards I was so tired but also starving because I had not eaten since the night before, the scents and aromas from this Taco Truck were amazing and I saw 4 guys already buying their lunch there, all of whom were Latino (no 1 rule, if you want good Mexican food, go where you see lots of Latino customers, Chinese Food , asian customers) i order a Super burrito with carnitas y carne asada, no frijoles, extra crema, extra savoia!!!This burrito was AMAZING! I will definitely patronize them again and I highly recommend them!!!! Delicioso!!!!
author: Sakkara C.

description:
randomly walked by here on my way to the flower market. i had never had a non-greasy, fatless yet still authentic burrito until i came here. nothing drips from the ends. their rice was perfect and they accept credit cards. 

i had tripe. no one ever offers that unless they really know how to cook it. plus points! they also have lengua, chorizo and tortas.
author: Thao T.

description: A great, quick place to grab tacos if you're in the area for jury duty. They do offer veggie tacos - they're good but nothing special. For instance, it includes rice, beans (your choice of refried, black, and something else I couldn't make out), lettuce, guacamole, sour cream, etc. The tacos are served Northern California style, meaning way over-filled for a taco. They also offer a choice between mild and spicy; the spicy is actually spicy, which is a nice change of pace from the terribly mild Mexican food found here. Not the best veggie taco you'll find, but a perfectly satisfying (and cheap - $2.50/taco) lunch. Credit cards accepted and there didn't seem to be a minimum.
author: Megan S.

description:
The best of part of having Jury Duty?  Getting to eat at El Norteno.  

Love these guys.  Always friendly service, totally willing to talk with you about exactly what you want in your Burrito.  No "language barrier" you know?  I had an awesome Breakfast Burrito today (not on the menu but they made me one anyway, which is cool) of eggs with Carnitas cooked "Machacha Style" (sauteed with onions and tomato.)

A bit pricey, yes, compared to other burrito shops in La Mission, but for the convenience factor, it's worth it.  You want cheap?  Go across the street to McDonald's then, you savage.  Enjoy eating the "food" they serve over there.  I'll be quite content with my REAL Burrrito with REAL hot sauce and REAL ingredients, from El Norteno, thank you very much.
author: FoodDudeS F.

description:
Burritos are tasty and spicy but not the best.  But like one writer states no prices posted; seller will make prices up. I used a restaurant.com coupon and I was charged $23 for a regular chicken burrito and a shrimp burrito everything but no sour cream.  A bit pricey.  Add to the fact  one burrito was missing guacamole.  Out the pocket cost was $18 which was almost full price.  So buyer beware.
Pancho Villa still has much better shrimp burrito.
author: K C.

description: So I'm stuck on jury duty and super thankful  that this little truck is across the street. I've tried the al pastor and crane asada tacos and the chicken burrito. All we're really tasty, full of flavor and quality ingredients. I'll be back even after I'm excused from wasting my life away across the street in court.
author: Megan N.

description:
This is my favorite taco truck ever; we go there at least once a week and can't resist the camarones sandwich which they smother in some kind of amazing crack sauce. They've also got tripe, tongue, brain and some other specialties but I can only vouch for the shrimp. It's a little pricey but the portions are big.

They're friendly, fast, and have a good selection of imported drinks too.
author: Simon B.

description:
Well, I hate that my first review is a negative one, but I must let the people know. 

Yesterday (Friday) I got a super burrito (chicken, black beans) from the truck for lunch. 

It has given me food poisoning. 

The burrito was tasty, and it's the second time I've eaten here. But sadly, my quality time with the toilet and entire Saturday of non-functionality, terrible stomach pains and inability to eat are telling me that I wont be back. 

Hopefully I can eat tomorrow :(
author: Ben O.

description:
I read through the reviews here, and decided to have a selection of tacos rather than a burrito for my first visit. I got to the truck at noon on a Tuesday, anticipating at least a ten-minute wait, but there was only one other person near the truck and he had already ordered. I was planning on getting a carne asada, carnitas, lengua and fish taco, but apparently they don't have fish tacos, so I got an al pastor instead. Grand total of six dollars.

In less than five minutes, I had my order bagged up and ready to go, so I hustled back to the office and found a spot to eat. My first impression upon opening the box was that there was not that much meat. Also, they only include 1 lime wedge and 1 napkin, which for an order of four tacos is not enough. However, they do include a few slices of carrot, radishes and jalapeno.

The tacos come with chopped cilantro, chopped onions, and a green salsa that is definitely legit spicy. My favorite of the tacos had to be the al pastor, as the meat was perfectly spiced, tender, juicy, flavorful and cooked just right. The carne asada was solid, but not amazing; it was tender, but it lacked flavor. The carnitas falls into the same category, cooked well but just not that flavorful. And to round out the taco feast, I had my first experience with lengua, and I found it similar to the carne asada except much softer (imagine a cow's tongue...yep).

All in all, I was a tiny bit disappointed. I was hoping to fall in love, but I did not. If I could give this place 3.75 stars, I would.
author: Geoff L.

description:
I got the carne asada burrito and was disappointed.  The meat was chewy, like rubber from a tire.  Everything including the rice was equally bad.  I'm not sure if I ordered the wrong thing at this place?
Not sure what the hype is all about.
author: Orry M.

description: Best Taco Truck on the 850 strip! The tacos Al Pastor and Carnita burritos are the bomb!
author: Fernando V.

description: I don't think I've ever had a torta until I've been to this place. My coworker, who's Mexican, told me he was going to get tortas from this place last week and I decided to join him. The torta's come in either 1 piece or 3 pieces, no 2 pieces. Very weird. It worked in our favor cuz I only wanted 1 and my coworker wanted 2. The entire thing comes wrapped in its original bread loaf package. It's basically like all the contents of a burrito, but in between a loaf of bread. It's delicious, hearty, and for 3 pieces, it was only $11! What a steal. I absolutely loved every bite! There's always a line here and you know its good when there's a bunch of Mexican people waiting in line! I will definitely be back many times!
author: Rosie W.

description:
LOVE THIS TACO TRUCK!  I've been having lunch there.....a couple of times a week.....for over 10 years.  First off.....it is clean....and proudly posts their 100 rating.  The food is very tasty......and fresh.  I'm a creature of habit....and like the Super Tacos.....with carne asada.  The tacos are soft, warm corn tortillas with freshly cooked meat... guacamole.... sour cream...
with all the fixings....along with beans and rice.  I especially like their pickled carrots.....I wish they sold them in pint jars!!!....  And a fresh lime brings everything together.  Best part.....  They take phone orders....so I don't have to wait in line.  I call....and my order is ready when I arrive.  
Awesome family operation.  Super nice people!!  Dare I say....?
"Best Taco Truck in SF!"
author: Bryan M.

description:
randomly found this taco truck walking on the way to SO...

i tried 4 tacos:  chicken, al pastor, carne asada, and carnitas...it comes with fresh lime wedges, jalepenos, sliced radishes, and extra salsa if you ask for it...
http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?userid=gUkqdzdD0jhqsjM-AZAWVw&select=GltyrsGOhWA-l1UE3_l43g
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/2ZgnUtbF_qqbyfKZ9Tvhcg?select=GltyrsGOhWA-l1UE3_l43g
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/2ZgnUtbF_qqbyfKZ9Tvhcg?select=uXKObadlyIpeBv7Oatu7rQ
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/2ZgnUtbF_qqbyfKZ9Tvhcg?select=s22vMGsxJxR-8DRNzTQVNg

the tacos were decent...i wouldn't come out of my way just for the tacos...but...i would for the eye candy...i'm not that desperate...well, maybe a little ;-)
author: Amanda S.

description:
Holy crap that's a good burrito.

$9.50 for a carne asada super burrito and 500ml of Hecho en Mexico Coca Cola.

Today was my first visit and I found them at Harriet and Brannan, not on Bryant like my fellow yelpers found. I guess they move around?

I'll definitely be back again the next time I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Aaron M.

description: I was riding my bike around the city and I seen this truck around this location and I said ill give it a shot and it was or is good. The price on menu is excellent and there burritos will make you full. Every think taste good, Just like a restaurant but on wheels.
author: Anthony G.

description:
Get the lengua. I know, I was a little turned off by the idea of eating tongue. Never again will I doubt how amazing tongue is when it's prepared properly, as they do here.

It is so tender I don't know what to do about it. Foodgasm at first bite. The lengua is definitely the best thing I have tried here.

I like the carne asada burrito as well, but the lengua! Why aren't you eating here already?
author: Angeline P.

description:
So I was reading reviews for this on my way to Off The Grid in Upper Haight. There were some great, some okay, and some eh wasn't that great causing me to look forward to it. I was trying really hard not to get my hopes up, but looking forward to it nonetheless. I asked my friend to order (because he speaks Spanish and it's just easier that way) two carne asada super tacos. He got a carne asada super burrito. We both bit into this & looked at each other & said, "WHAT THE HECK. THIS CAME FROM A FREAKING TRUCK?" 

Maybe I'm just a naive taco truck noob (seeing as this was my first time), but this was probably the one of the (if not THE) best taco/burrito I've ever tasted. We both shared our goods & agreed it was pretty dang awesome. My friend absolutely found it amazing, and he was born & raised on this stuff so I trust him 100%! 

As said before, the super tacos are $3 & something cents for the first one, then $2 for everyone after. $8 for a super burrito, which is a little expensive for a taco truck... so I've heard... BUT IT'S WELL WORTH IT. I promise you!

Can't wait to hit this place up again! It's amazing!
author: Krissel A.

description:
I came here to seek out the famous chivo (goat) burrito.  But as Wes M encountered, they were out.  It makes me wonder if they put these items on the menu for authenticity (brains, tripe) but don't carry them at lunch for all us gringos?

So no chivo burrito, but the owner really lit up when I seemed disappointed and convinced me to get their pepper stewed pork special instead.  Okay, it didn't really take a lot of convincing.  I winced a little at the price ($11.25 instead of the $7.50 for a super burrito) and hoped I really really liked it and wasn't about to be ripped off.  Hanging around the truck, waiting for my meal, I came to the conclusion that they were happy to have someone order something other than a carne asada burrito and were therefore whipping up something good.

After 10-15 minutes my food was ready to load up on my bike to take back to work.

Well, for $11.25 I really got a meal.  A little bit of pinto beans, a little bit of rice, and a lot of pork.  Really tender on the bone pork.  Stewed in a really bright orange/red spicy sauce with green peppers.  I knew it was more than I should be eating for lunch (when you get older portion control becomes a huge thing) but couldn't help eating everything.  Also got a hot bundle of 4 thick corn tortillas.  Not sure what I was supposed to do, make a wrap?  But just tore them up and dipped them into the sauce like naan bread.  De-lish.

Will have to go back and try the chivo again.  Next time I'll call ahead of time.
author: Jean K.

description:
Simple and perfect that is all you need when describing an authentic taco truck.  Carnitas and Pastor are stellar although everything is fresh and a total bargain compared to some of their competitors. I have also been fortunate enough to have used them for catering and they are even better at your house than they are at 6th and Bryant!!

Love these folks, a great family operation!  A++
author: Curtis G.

description:
Friendly staff. I do not catch them at off the grid, just because its too busy and they are by my work M-F, no wait and take phone orders. Different staff for the last few years since I've worked nearby for almost 3 years. 

I've tried the other meats and so far I love this place for their Super Tacos Carnitas which they always serve with beans and rice to the side.
author: Sheena S.

description: I have been here several times and each time love the tacos! They are VERY spicy so if you don't like spice, make sure you tell them mild! They get very busy during the lunch hour but the food is worth the wait - not to mention the friendly service each time, regardless of how busy they are. The only reason I did not give them a 5 star is because it seems expensive for a taco truck.
author: Elise Z.

description:
Scored!!!  I stopped by here for a quick lunch with some coworkers and really enjoyed my meal.  The prices aren't posted, so you have to ask.  Tacos are $1.50 each and they have quite a good variety of meats to choose from.  I decided on the super taco for $3.50, $2 each for every taco after.  I had the pastor and chorizo, which was piled on with generous amounts of guacamole, sour cream, and cheese, and then topped off with jalapenos and radishes.  It also came with a side of rice and beans.  Their green and red hot sauces had lots of flavor.  

Overall, it was a delicious, filling, & cheap meal!  I'll definitely be back the next time I'm in the area.
author: Cynthia H.

description:
I caught up with these guys at off the grid. I made my typical order skeptical as to what I would get:

Al Pastor burrito, no rice, pinto beans and hot sauce

What did I get? A monstrous meat burrito with a little bit of pinto beans, and great hot sauce. San Francisco Mexican is notorious for filling their burritos with 75% rice and beans because they are either cheap or rent is expensive. Not this family owned and operated truck In addition the Al Pastor was amazing!!!!!
author: Bryan M.

description:
I have eaten here for almost 2 years, and they have never let me down.
I've tried everything from a taco to a torta and it's all delicious. 
I've become quite a fan of their carnitas and al pastor, and that's not the only yummy foods available. Even three tacos i consider a good filling meal because they put so many different things to make it delicious from hot sauce, rice, cream, you name it they have it fresh and satisfying!
They're usually on 6th and bryant but you can also find them throughout many corners of the city like off the grid on the upper haight and many more to come. I'd highly recommend them for caterings for any sort of gathering. Authentic Mexican food at it's finest.
author: Lori B.

description:
I had high expectations because it's a 4.5 stars.

I had 4 carnitas tacos with hot salsa.  What I usually get at a taco truck.  It was definitely tasty, but the carnitas was a bit dry (dryer than I'm used to).  The tortillas were good, and the salsa was decent.

They were very fast and no wait for the line.

One of the people I went with had a hair in their burrito.  A long one. 

Maybe I'll give the Al Pastor a shot if I go again.
author: Michael L.

description:
These taco are addictive! Let me begin by saying I just moved from back east and never ate these type of soft taco's. I went to 3 other taco places then to El Norteno... I struck gold. The other places were double or triple the price and not as flavorful. . The staff was extremely pleasant. I had  the chicken, beef, and chorizo . 
I am looking forward to Monday to go back!!
author: Robert O.

description:
I eat here a lot.
The only thing that makes me sick is hearing you complain about this place.
(bump: 5 stars!)
author: Bruce L.

description:
This place is so popular with my coworkers, that when we moved our old office into a new neighborhood, we named one of our new conference rooms after this.  Seriously.

This is easily my favorite taco truck in the city.  I always get the Burrito Supreme.  Nom.  It can be a tad pricey in my opinion for truck food, but since its so good, and so big, I always shell out.

There is no parking in this area of the city, so when we take a field trip from work to the old hood its always a bitch.  But once we take a bite or bring back our bounty to the office and eat it in front of others jealous we went with out them, its worth it.
author: Jen K.

description: This place is, THE BOMB! The tacos are super delicious, I haven't found another great taco place in San Francisco as good as this truck for tacos.  Its cheap, fast, and they are really nice.  Its pretty fresh as well.  They have a constant and steady traffic flow for lunch because its that good. I usually get only tacos Al Pastor, Carne Asada, and Carnitas. I've also had the lengua tacos there and it is pretty delicious as well. This is definitely a place to eat at.
author: Thanh H.

description:
Perfect!

Only a buck fifty per taco, and totally delicious. They're the traditional small taco, with two five inch tortillas and a heap of filling. I had pretty tame meats (chicken, beef, lamb), but they also have brains, stomach, tripe, and more for the adventurous eaters.

And the service was quite nice, too--a friendly guy who's apparently lived in SF for 42 years, and owned the taco truck for half of that.
author: David Z.

description:
No surprises here, and nothing that's going to blow your mind. Good carnitas & al pastor. Lately my favorite has been two 'super' tacos - for $5 you get your choice of two tacos with with cheese, guac, sour cream, rice & beans, plus pickled carrots, jalapeno & radishes. And a lime wedge. A great lunch value! They also make hefty breakfast burritos for about $4. One time I got the 'half' torta de camarones ($9) and that thing was freaking awesome but about the size of a Gideon bible, way too much food. I pity the fool that tries to tackle the the 'full' ($19).

Last time around, they got a 100% from the health inspector:

http://www.dph.sf.ca.us/eh/Violations/Loc_CurrentViol.asp?LocationID=5297

But please note that if you want your food spicy, they will make it spicy. Usually the conversation goes:

-- I'll have a super carnitas burrito, spicy please.

-- You want that very spicy, right boss?

I've only gotten ill once from eating at this place, and it was when I answered 'yes' to that question. There was nothing particularly wrong with it, mind you - I just couldn't handle it. Consider yourself warned.
author: Dave P.

description:
Let's start off by saying I don't eat at taco trucks. Or Korean bbq trucks. Or any type of trucks.  So of course, on a rare afternoon around lunchtime where my husband and I are both free, he decides to take me to "one of his favorite hidden gems" - and voila, the Taco Truck across from the Hall of Justice.  

I am skeptical, but my love for burritos won.  After my husband rattles off his four tacos order like a regular, I nudge him and he orders me a carne asada burrito.  

Fifteen minutes later, alone in the parking lot of Bed Bath and Beyond (don't ask), I eat the burrito.  Delicious.   Perfectly cooked to order carne asada, non-soggy beans, fluffy rice.  I am the biggest fan of what I call dry burritos (no creepy sauce on top to make the burrito all soggy).  My only regret was that I forgot to order cheese and guacamole.  Plus the fact that, for a regular burrito, it was pretty damn huge.  In hindsight, best not eaten ghetto style in the parking lot of Bed Bath and Beyond.

He now wants me to try the Korean BBQ truck.  We'll see.
author: Patricia K.

description:
OVERALL: 4.3

FOOD: 4.5
SERVICE: 4
AMBIANCE: n/a
VALUE: 4.5

Round 2 of SFMOMA-75...went for an Al Pastor Quesadilla based purely on Yelps.  Gimongous grilled, flaky tortilla stuffed with melted cheese & pork, avocados, pico & sour cream on the side.  Never had al pastor anything, and am now a convert...spicy chile mix w/cumin (?) and something deliciously reminiscent of Middle Eastern shawerma meets Chinese CharSiu pork....I know, right?

As I was contemplating my last wedge of porky cheese heaven, I got a major case of taco-envy watching the people around me scarf down their carnitas, but there was no way anything else was fitting down the hatch.


Great first taco truck experience!
author: Amy K.

description:
WHERE was this effing truck at 4:38pm today?  Where?  Not where it usually sits in the parking lot.  It wasn't there when I needed it.  When I needed a small, snacky, non-chip type snack.  I WAS ALL ALONE!!!!

But usually, it has some terrific tacos for a lovely decent price.  They are $1.50 each and have loads of stuff in them.  3 will fill you up for under $5.  

The quesadilla smells delicious too.  And they have the pickled jalapenos that I always forget to add.  

BUT THEY WERE NOT THERE WHEN I NEEDED MY PRE-GYM SNACK.  I hate you taco truck.
author: Christina C.

description: They charged me $6 for a pinto and rice burrito.  Dry as hell.  NO!
author: Light Bulb J.

description:
This truck has the best burrito I've had yet. Sure it's a little 'pricey' for a truck. But what you're paying for is the consistency and the quality of this delicious food. Just one of these burritos is like two meals. Cut it in half and save it for later. 

My point is, if you want to complain about the price, don't go out at all! Pack your lunch! Everything around SOMA is likely to be $10+. This truck is better than most of those places anyway. I'm super serial. 

P.S. Best breakfast burrito you've ever had in your life son!
author: Hank K.

description:
Holy carne asada, the tacos at this place are muy bueno! 

The carne asada steak is cooked to perfection - packed with juicy flavor, tasty seasoning, and generously heaped upon delectable corn tortillas. What's great is that the tacos here taste fresher and far less greasy than those I've had at other taco carts. And at only $1.50 a piece, three of these bad boys is enough to make a satisfying meal that your wallet can enjoy, too! Each taco is topped with salsa, a couple additional veggies, and not much else, but I have no qualms with that.  I still think the tacos here rival some of the best I've had in SOMA"s friendly neighborhood to the southwest. 

The same cannot be said for the chicken tacos, my only -1. They were pretty good, yes, but certainly not spectacular. I thought the chicken was a little dry and didn't have much flavor. Next time I will be sure to order 3 carne asada tacos instead.

Next time I visit this taco truck again (and bring with me a bigger appetite) I will definitely need to try the tortas, which I heard are huge and incredibly tasty.
author: Joseph F.

description:
Still the best lengua tacos ever! 

Recently tried another truck.  The poor lengua's flavor had been boiled out of it. I reminded my GF that I though El Norteno had the best lengua taco. 

Last week they came back to McCoppin Hub, so were there just after they opened for business. Proved my point. She agreed. El Norteno has the best lengua taco we've tasted thus far in SF! 

We both walked back home with our smiles on!
author: S A.

description:
So today at work, a poem is passed to me:

"n---
I went to the burrito truck
and I got a super carnitas burrito
it is
the greatest burrito of my life
 fact."

A poem like that is a call to action. I walked over immediately and can confirm that today was Burrito Star Alignment Day at the El Norteno taco truck. The carnitas was blackened on the edges and the tortilla was grilled. There was no salsa but burritos this good do not need salsa! Salsa here would only get in the way. Every taste complemented every other taste, to form a perfectly interlocking, ultimate burrito flavor profile.

Yes I have eaten at every burrito place in this damn town. We have a winner.
author: Ian G.

description:
Dang, I knew I should have ordered more prudently. Wifey and I had bought some KGB deals and finally were able to make their very limited hours since we do not live or work that close to the trucks. It is a shame because we are often in the area of the trucks at night, but they are not open. Anyhow, we ordered somewhat redundantly, which might have screwed us. By virtue of that, what is truly a 2.5 star review gets the benefit of the doubt as a 3 star review. Also keep in mind that I just got back from San Diego and ate nothing but Mexican food while there, so my standards are very inflated since they have the best style Mx food in the US there. 

Wifey got the carnitas quesadilla and a buche taco for $10.50! and I had the buche burrito (all meat AKA SD style for $8.50) and the carnitas taco ($2). The burrito was a reasonable size, but still much smaller than the ones I was getting in SD last week for $4, but I digress. I'll start with the good. The carnitas were actually pretty good. They were mostly very soft, not that deep fried crap that they try to pass off as carnitas in places like, oh say, Texas. They had a decent smokey flavor and a little bit of crispness on the outside from the roasting. I liked them overall in the taco. The quesadilla, however, just didn't come together. I did not like the cheese that they used, not sure what type it was, but it did not really melt all that well. That being said, I think I prefer cheddar and colby blends of cheese over authentic Mexican cheese in my quesadillas, so they shouldn't lose points for my lack of authenticity. The tortillas that they used, however, were not very good, as is the case with most places that I have been up here. Very rubbery and they do not have the nice flower-y powder on them that always gets on your hands from really good flower tortillas. 

The major issue here was the buche. It was terrible. I have never had buche that was this bad, or even bad at all, so I am clearly not a very critical customer when it comes to my organ meats. This version was completely bland, absolutely no flavor, and was so chewy that it was almost inedible. I have never been to a place that had good carnitas and bad buche because I think they usually get cooked similarly and come out with a similar smokey flavor. This was not the case and it was horrible. Why didn't I get the pollo asado burrito like I planned and just a buche taco? I mean, really, who orders buche from a truck where they have never eaten before? A guy who gets really excited about eating the stomach of a cow, that's who. 

Anyway, I can't complain about the price because we had our 1/2 off coupons, but otherwise I would complain quite a bit! Unfortunately, we will not be able to give them another shot because of the price, the inconvenience of the location and hours, and the fact that we would rather have the option of sitting inside and enjoying our food rather than waiting until we get home or eating at picnic tables in a grimey side street. BTW, I did not ding them for the fellow we passed who was shooting up into his leg in broad daylight on our way back to our car with our food.
author: Miguel V.

description:
El Norteno raises their four star lunch game to five for breakfast. I was starved. Late of dancing. Ravenous stomach. Needed food. Saw the truck, hoped that they were still serving breakfast. Affirmative. The guy staffing the truck told me, his newest amigo, I could have whatever I wanted. What about an egg whites, shrimp, black beans and mild sauce taco? Done.

A few minutes later hunger was satisfied. Heart and soul replenished by the combo of Cosmic Gate and breakfast taco euphoria.
author: Jason B.

description:
How in the world did you get That into a burrito?  
 
Bleh..  Don't go to this place.  I ordered a burrito from this place a while ago.  I was thinking: for 8 bucks this burrito better be pretty good.   

It wasn't.  I mean it was alright.  It was lukewarm, sorta like you would expect a burrito to be after sitting there on the shelf of a taco truck.

not only that, but while I was eating, I found a small pebble/rock in the burrito.  It was rough, and probably slightly smaller than the size of a marble.  My question is, how in the world do you get something like that into a burrito?  Maybe I don't really want to know the answer to that.
author: colin l.

description:
$10 for a mediocre super al pastor burrito + 1 jarritos, no chips, no salsa?  I guess it's ok if you're just in it to rip off the local bail bondsman -- they seem to be the only authentic mexican within quite a few blocks -- but I really wanted more for my money.

The al pastor itself was decent and the tortilla was grilled, but I think maybe they had it pre-made and were just keeping it warm.  Not sure, but there was a real dryness to the burrito that made me suspect that.
author: DowntownSnobs Z.

description:
Their burritos are awesome and huge.  Way better than the ones from the tonayense in my opinion, but they are a bit different in flavors.

Yes it's cheap and they seem to only be around during the weekdays from the lunch/afternoon hours.
author: Simon Y.

description: Lamb burrito was bursting with flavor and somehow managed to be even better than the carnitas one. I'd bump the rating up but 4.5 stars isn't possible. I only leave the last half star off because of the pricing.
author: Josh K.

description:
Delicious and cheap tacos! This place (or rather truck) gets pretty hopping during lunch time for the Hall of Justice folks. I usually order 3-4 tacos, each with a different main ingredient. I love the carnitas and fish. Although their tacos are super awesome, I can't say the same thing about their burrito. I thought they were on the dry side. But if you like that, then it can definitely fill you up AND give you a super comfortable food coma afterwards, because the burrito is pretty hefty. Their pricing on the menu is hard to see, even when you are up close. I speculate it's just worn out from the years, but the owners should definitely make it clearer.

Highly recommended this taco truck!
author: Sam W.

description: I have been frequenting this place about once a week for a year, so it's a travesty that I haven't raved about it yet. It's the place to go if you want a standard taco truck taco or burrito, or a ginormous torta (the small is the size of my head). The gentleman who takes your order is super friendly, and the food is consistent, without fail. And, they're there even on a rainy day, which I appreciate from my food trucks.
author: Turi F.

description:
The 800 block of Bryant is not exactly the happiest place on earth.  In fact, I bet it's pretty close to the classic city image that those timid suburbanites always conjure up, from that bleak gray courthouse to the grimy industrial setting to the seedy-looking Bail Bonds shops and the not-so-smiling faces of the passersby.  But El Norteno will put all that out of your mind.

I have to say El Norteno is even better then El Tonayense, my last experience with a Taco Truck.  They're well-known for their burritos de chivo (goat), but alas, they were all out when I came by, so I had to settle for a carnitas.  Still, it was a perfect burrito: gigantic, of course, with a flaky tortilla and plenty of sour cream to moisten the well-proportioned (and well-heated) meat, rice, and beans.  Amazingly, it didn't put me into a food coma either.  Truly, a must for any burrito fan, even if it's a bit off your beaten path.  I, for one, will be counting the days till I get my hands on that goat burrito...
author: Wes M.

description:
I've been going to this Taco Truck for years.  Excellent Al Pastor & Carne Asada.  Never gotten sick.

Well thats not entirely true.  Its spicy and makes me sick all the time.  But never food poisoning sick.  Food poisoning makes you sick for 24 hours.  6 hours on the toilet is totally acceptable for a good burrito.

Man up, previous reviewers.
author: Steve S.

description: I really like their steak taco's. When i was working for Prisoner Legal Services, I use to walk to this Taco Truck when i was in need of a quick bite.
author: kimiko l.

description: The family that owns the El Norteno Taco Truck also run a catering company called El Norteno Catering Service.  The catering company provided the incredible food for my office Christmas party.  The food, set-up and service was fantastic.  I will be using El Norteno Catering again.
author: Loren L.

description:
I've been an El Norteno fan since they used to be located at the turnaround at Henry Adams and 8th Sts.  When they moved, I panicked!  Then a friend hipped me to their new spot.  The parking isn't as easy as it used to be (I guess that's always the case, ain't it?), but I can't knock any stars off the rating, because the parking attendant at Bryant & Harriet is cool, especially if you buy him a soda.  

The carne asada and pastor tacos are my fave.  Simple, satisfying, fresh, and no-nonsense.  Best of all, they respect my love for their food; they don't even bat an eye when I ask for my usual SIX tacos.  I wash that down with nothing other than those super-sweet Mexican bottles of CocaCola, and I'm in Heaven.  

They've recently doubled up on the small corn tortillas for easy handling, but I still love them.
author: Sheila G.

description:
I used to work near here and it was recommended by a friend.  Here are some things I observed before I tried it:

1) It's parked across the street from the courthouse and police station every day, so a large number of their repeat customers are lawyers and police officers.  (AKA: extremely low chance of food poising!!!)

2) The good number of their repeat customers are brown skinned and speak mostly Spanish like my brethren down south.

I tried it.  It was amazing.  I jones for their burritos, tacos, and tamales whenever I think of the place.  I've had everything from carne asada to their chivo (aka: goat).  Chivo is great in a taco, but a bit much in a burrito.  

If you're feeling brave they stock very spicy jabanero peppers which they will happily Julienne and use to mine your burrito with if you request it.  If you're not into flaming hot chili bombs every other bite causing a natural opiate rush similar to one you would get after being thrown down a flight of concrete steps I recommend trying some on the side in a taco before having your burrito mined with them as they are not easy to pick out.  I personally enjoy that sort of food-based pain/rush without the permanent damage or hospital bills.

I also highly recommend getting sides of green sauce with your food, or red if you prefer.  Both are homemade and amazing.

It's a bit inconvenient by car because there is no place to stop and park, and if you do you'll likely make one of the dozen or so police officers roaming the area leave you an expensive note about it on your windshield.  If you are on foot, like Mexican food and don't stop here, shame on you!!!

By the way, an al pastor burrito with re-fried beans and jabaneros is a great if not messy hangover cure.  Read my note above if you're not into flaming hot chilies.

And yes, it is on Bryant, not Brannon.

One final word:  I ate here every weekday for over a year and never got food poisoning.
author: Theron L.

description:
I'm giving this 5 start because you can't bet better mexican food anywhere in the neighborhood.

After reading the last dozen reviews, I'm shocked that no one has mentioned the gi-normous tortas! Try a super torta with whatever meat you fancy-- i  like it al pastor and with chivo when they have it... they use like a whole loaf of bread, and hollow it out to make room for the filling! You won't eat dinner if you finish one of these for lunch. 

And yes the tacos are also bomb here.. they serve them with some radishes and odd pickled vegetable if I remember correctly. 

So after you get that ticket dismissed, or even if you don't, just remember you're still free....and go celebrate at el Norteño taco truck.
author: D L.

description: A tasty haven from Jury Duty!  I sat through a long-but-interesting jury selection process during which I almost exclusively thought about where I would eat for lunch.  Enter El Norteno with its tasty burritos for all!  I had the shrimp (camarones) burrito which was excellent, one of the better shrimp burritos that I've had in the city...tasty fire grilled shrimp, excellent sauce, and a pretty decent-sized burrito.  It was a bit pricey for a taco truck ($10!) but I guess that's what the $15 daily juror pay is for...
author: Rosers M.

description:
MMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM Breakfast Burrito.....When I used to work on Townsend (employer need not be mentioned) My Old roomie and I would stop for breakfast there every couple of mornings and Oh god how I looked forward to those blissful moments......The walk in the rain, the crackhead who just got out of jail that mornin or the plethora of greasy men grabbin crotch and makin kissy faces at me couldnt slow me down. 

Not only was it huge ( again I reference size does matter) but a taste explosion for my usually bland tastebuds. SInce I havent worked down there in three years I have been saddened many a time thinkin I could just jaunt down there and arrive at heaven. *SIGH* Ive been makin everyone around me crazy lately talking about it and I think I may just have to call in late to work one day Hell I might even get one for my pops and head back so as not to get into trouble.....Yeah sounds good breakfast goodness here i come!!!
author: Shaunna K.

description:
First of all...

This ain't the roach coach. It gets perfect health inspection scores regularly. Check the SF gov site and the postings on their windows.

Second of all...

Pastor tacos. Carnitas burrito. Holy mierda. Muy effing awesomeo.
author: Josh B.

description:
This is the best Mexican in SOMA that I've found, and I eat about 4 burritos a week.  My suggestion, the LENGUA.  Best I've had in San Francisco.  The carnitas are also top notch, and they are not stingy with the quantities.  Note this is not a cheap taco truck.  But it is the same price as all the other Mexican places near the hall of justice and so much tastier so it's a winner in my book.  

One note though:  Don't waste your money on putting avocado in your burrito.  They really do skimp on that.  But for $.50 an avocado portion, if you ask for double avocado you'll be pleasantly surprised.
author: matthew w.

description:
There's a party in my mouth and this taco truck is invited. I have a big mouth.

Recommendations: carne asada quesadillas, getting there before Noon or after 1 PM, letting the 100 health rating pacify your fears, remembering to breath between inhaling tasty Mexican food.

Disrecommendations: fashion from 1991.
author: Nik B.

description: I just don't get it.  Everyone raves about this truck.  I ate there a year ago and it was forgetful.  Then all these people start telling me how "this is the one".  The best taco truck in San Francisco.  Ah, yeah... NOT.  I want there again last week.  Just so-so.  I think this is an example of hipsters believing hipsters and not really judging for themselves.
author: Christopher F.

description:
all I can say for other's miserable experiences.....EL PASTOR BURRITO SUPER...Can't get enough...
...6 bucks....tastes somehow better than most taqurias that almost lost the spicy flavourful taste in their food....maybe cause the taco truck doesn't  cater to their marina crowds....like other places...keeping stuff vary blan in taste
They have juicy good mex food....
author: Alex W.

description: I tried their new "Take it or leave it" burrito. It had hot links, beef, seasoned rice, and habanero and no beans. It was one of the best burritos I had in a long while. It was just the right size and packed a good amount of heat.
author: Clodel G.

description:
A very auspicious first couple of bites faded into a bit of a flavorless burrito.  I don't really know how to explain except that while the meat (I had carne asada) was good, there wasn't enough of it.  And it wasn't particularly cheap, which for a taco truck was surprising.

Extra points for the pickled veggies.
author: David K.

description: Popped by for lunch with my coworkers today.  $1.50 Al Pastor Tacos.  YUM!! Plus I added guac & sour cream to both my tacos.
author: Stacey L.

description: Yay! They are yummy, cheap, clean, and those boys running the show are hot. makes for great tacos. Thanks  El Norteno!
author: Devi G.

description:
Heard about this taco truck from this magazine that came in the Guardian claiming they make a bomb Breakfast Burrito.  Since I work in the area I made my down towards the court house

Note:
The Taco truck is hard to spot.  Harriet St is a small alley and if your not paying attention you could pass it.

Food:
I ordered the Potato, Bacon & Egg Burrito which came with whole pinto beans, rice, and fresh salsa.  Dang this burrito is huge!!!! The flour tortilla was surprisingly tasty compared to most burrito shops. The lady before ordered some Carne Asada taco's that really looked good. I also heard the Carne Asada Quesadilla is off the hook.  I think I'll try that next.

This a legit truck.  They proudly display the health code score which is 100.  I dropped 10 something for a burrito and Jarrito's soda.  A little pricey, but I will come back
author: Robert M.

description: I come here 2 to 3 times a month and I have yet to be disappointed.  I usually order the carne asada burrito or tacos.  The meat is always tender and flavorful with little to no gristle or fat.  I always get the chips although they are a bit on the hard side.  Love both the green and red salsa and if I'm feeling adventurous I will ask for the habanera salsa also. Overall the place is always clean and food is great.  Prices are reasonable also.
author: Mikky T.

description:
